lead_paragraph: When Mike Reynolds vowed a year and a half ago to find a way to keep repeat offenders locked up for life, it seemed just a howl of pain by a grieving father whose teen-age daughter had been shot in the head at point-blank range by a man with a long criminal record. But Mr. Reynolds's personal crusade to tighten sentencing for career criminals has become a political juggernaut here in California, the scene in recent weeks of several high-profile crimes, including the abduction and slaying of 12-year-old Polly Klaas at the hands of a twice-convicted kidnapper.

headline.main: Drive to Keep Repeat Felons In Prison Gains in California
